name: House of Lashes¬Æ Eyelash Adhesive
about: What it is: A latex-free adhesive formulated for long-lasting wear...Ingredient Callouts: Free of parabens, formaldehydes, and phthalates...What Else You Need to Know:¬†This lash adhesive is formulated for long-lasting wear. It features a unique bottle with an easy-to-use brush applicator. The formulation is latex-free and waterproof‚Äîperfect for latex-sensitive and contact-wearing individuals. This product is safe to use for those with sensitive eyes and it is not tested on animals.
ingredients: Methyl Methacrylate Crosspolymer, Sodium Acrylate Copolymer, Methylacrylate-Acid, Vitamin E, Aqua (Water, Eau)
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Coat the false eyelash band with lash glue..-Allow it to sit for 40 or more seconds..-Wait for the glue to become tacky before applying the false eyelash for better adhesion. ...Tips and Tricks: .-Clean false eyelashes after three to four wears. .-Use your favorite makeup remover and a Q-tip to gently swab the false eyelashes and band. -Gently remove any excess lash glue with tweezers or your fingers. ...Caution: .-Use only as directed. .-Apply the glue only to the false eyelashes band..-Apply the lash band to your eyelid above your lash line. .-Do not apply the glue or lash band directly to your natural eyelashes.

reviews.review_text: This product and I have a love/hate relationship, but I find I can‚Äôt function without it... so only you can choose for yourself. I only first used false eyelashes recently.. because I was always so intimidated by the process. However, I found it changed my whole look, and I could wear so little makeup & still look made up - so it‚Äôs worth the effort. But finding the right glue was clearly the issue, and duo and drugstore brands were allowing corners to pop off. So as always I went with YOUR suggestions & got HOL in black which works esp well because I wear liquid eyeliner in black. The upside is JUST as you all say... the hold is AMAZING.. doesn‚Äôt compare to other brands and I never have to worry, those lashes are staying in place. NO MATTER WHAT. However I REALLY struggled my first tube. I was still clumsy with lashes & my glue tube would be in one hand and end up sitting sideways, tipping etc and I had it drip on my white bed, a pink sweater, and I‚Äôm not kidding even my cat at one point. If you‚Äôve been to see La Brea tar pits it mimics that - the stuff the dinosaurs died in because they couldn‚Äôt move. It‚Äôs NOT coming out of fabric, ever and its STICKY. So the tube opening becomes sticky over time & wand tends to dry w/clumps if you don‚Äôt close up often. Learning to apply properly is so essential because where ever the first place you touch it to will leave a small line of ‚Äòtar‚Äô on your eye that you then feel compelled to take off, and as people mention, this requires a strong oil based remover. However then you would have oily residue there. So I have found keeping q tips around with some alcohol just in case I make little mistakes. Yes it isn‚Äôt great wiping that near my eye but for me I just found it works, I‚Äôm sure each person has their solution. So now I know, lashes on before any other eye make up, before any decent piece of clothing, and very careful application taking my time to do it right with instruments that put them in the correct place first time.
